title: I think Riot forgot that AP is suposed to be a cheaper stat than AD
body:
AD items are completely Outclassing AP items right now.. IE better than Rabadon by a mile Trinity force and duskblade are so much better than LichBane By a mile.

Its really lame as a AP champion when your best bet is rush either Magic Pen Items only and try snowball with base dmg vs the AD opponent to get item advantage or go for a ton of CDR and hope to kite them.

The best item with Ap right now is Gunblade in its own division and theres too many wasted stats that most AP champions cant build it and also cant afford to place this item in their inventory..

I remember when you could easily have 2 times more AP than AD Late game With Rabadon and a full AP build but now since rabadon is sooooo expensive its soo hard to build and you need too much items to do damage late game with all the retarded ad items they added and buffed over the time..

Im not talking about ad champs like zed or jhin who have more ad than i have ap late game im talking about pretty much every AD champions who have more AD than i have AP at 5 items if i go for a build like {{item:3152}} {{item:3100}} {{item:3157}} {{item:3135}} {{item:3102}} 
And the people who are going to tell me (But you have UTILITY with those items)
.
So does {{item:3156}} {{item:3147}} {{item:3814}} {{item:3812}} 

You even Rush IE on a ton of ADCs now even when its suposed to be an item you get a bit later to make it more cost efficient with its passive..

Do you know anybody who goes Rabadon First item? NO because its dog shit but at the same time you NEED that item late game 

Right now on {{champion:245}} i go a build like {{item:3152}} {{item:3100}} {{item:3089}} I Get rabadon 3rd almost all of my games despite mr or not because i know its gonna be too hard to build that item past 3 items.. {{item:3135}} then last item is something with heavy cdr because you also NEED to Cap Cdr late game on a ap champion {{item:3115}} {{item:3165}} 

Riot balance team must probably not play many AP champions because its just lame to be at 4 items without rabadon and trying to build it and even when you have a largerod in your inventory you need 2550 gold to build it.... thats 2 more largerod...

Remember the TSM VS C9 Spring Final? 

Jensen was playing {{champion:245}} late game he had no rabadon at 4 items he was building it 5th item he was sitting with a largerod but had 2k+ gold still he couldnt buy the rabadon because the item is way too fuking expensive so he brought a ludens since it was the most expensive ap item he could buy.
He spent almost 2k gold for 40 more ap and a discount duskblade passive resulting in him not having enough AP late game for his spells to work properly at that stage so his shield was way too low than he trought it would be and he got insta killed trough his shield.

I really hope Riot looks into AP Items after all the change they are doing with MR Buffs AD items Buffs Nerfing everything Ability Power Related 
I mean stuff like cassio are building tank items now like comon wtf is that?

All im saying is that they should probably increase the AP value only on some items and make Rabadon a bit cheaper to compete with all the ad items we have right now.

Tell me what you think.

The problem comes from how AP works as a stat compared to AD.

Building AD has a 1:1 ratio with a game element all physical damage dealers use -- their auto attacks. AP however is gated 100% of the time by the AP ratios of champion abilities. 

With AD, it's a simple question to answer: How much gold is adding 10 damage to your auto attacks worth? (It's 350 gold)

How much gold is adding 20 damage to your skillshot worth? (There isn't an answer)

Unless every single champion that builds AP has at least one skill with 100% AP scaling, it is always going to be a nightmare to itemize while physical damagers get reliable, grokkable AD forever.

The closest thing in the game to making AP a consistent stat is {{item:3115}}, which still ends up making AP a laughable contribution compared to AD.
It still beats having full ad teams tho.

Full AD teams are actually viable.  They definitely have their drawbacks - you're likely better off with mixed damage - but they CAN work.

Meanwhile full AP teams are such trash as to be completely unthinkable.

Personally I think that's rather unfair, but I guess that's simply my opinion.
Full AD teams are viable if your opponent's team don't have tanks.
{{champion:42}} boom done full ad team (doesn't matter that he does magic damage, he's an ad champ).

What matters is the type of damage you do, not what you build or what your abilities scale with.

Cause by your logic, I can just run {{champion:85}} AD. Boom - full AP team, dosent matter if hes an AP champ.

No, you just used the opposite of my logic.

Corki builds primarily AD items, but does magic damage.  That makes him still an ad champion, even though he does primarily magic damage.

This is a discussion of AD vs AP, not physical damage vs magic damage.  There's a huge difference.

Also, there is no such thing as full AP teams. There is always at least the ADC doing physical damage. Unless your ADC is Corki (which, even though still AD, does 80% magic damage), which is the only possible situation where you don't have to build armor at all. As a tank, you will almost always have to dedicate half of your item slots to armor just to counter the ADC, and that actually makes "full AP" teams (comps with 4 magic damage champions and the ADC) viable. Meanwhile, full AD teams are trash against well made team compositions that have enough tanks. But are viable against squishies, because against them it doesn't matter what you choose, they will die anyway.

Yes, that is actually my point, thank you.  :)

You can run full AD teamcomps fairly well.  They struggle a little in the midgame when tanks have a few items, but they can either dominate and steamroll early on or outscale later on.  Teamcomps with 2 ADCs + 3 tanks are becoming increasingly more common as well.

But you can't run a full AP team comp.  Your team MUST have an ADC, no matter what, or you pretty much lose.  Even if the enemy team is a bunch of squishies, there are more (and better) options for squishies to build magic resist than armor.

There's only one role that every team is required to have, and that's ADC.

>In point of fact, I think Morello's is actually a little too powerful and could be tweaked down a bit.

The joke with Morello is that it has everything a mage would require (except m.pen), but at the same time Rito removed the only alternative while simultaneously putting the passive of that item onto Morello.

Athene's was moved to be an AP oriented support item as mana regen and raw mana were differentiated as stats for mages and supports. Athene's and Morello's before all of this were the same item basically. The only one getting bought was the one who had better stats. That's why Riot gave every AP item different thing and moved some extras for supports.

Athene's isn't bad. If you're a shielding mid laner, your damage serves as a potential heal for allies. But this is rather limited as you'd rather do more damage than heal someone and there are no AP supports that shield or heal that deal damage to benefit from Athene's in that way. Only Soraka or Janna come to mind and they are babysitting supports that are absolutely devoted to supporting an ally. Sona might be there somewhere (and Karma), possibly Lulu but considering how every other genuine support item is better due to Windspeaker's and Censer, pure AP supports like Brand can't even use its passive.

Morello and Athene were different both in stats, their scope and role.

Saying they were the same item would be like saying Bloodthirster and Blade of the Ruined King are basically the same item.

thee? Aren't you referring yourself? If so, that would be essentially just be the same as modern English pronouns, and if you're referring to yourself you also wouldn't use 'hast' because that was used as the second-person singular present from of 'have,' and it's not necessary to refer to yourself in the second-person in this context, because in this context you can't really use second-person pronouns to address yourself due to the fact that you're the subject of the sentence, and also the speaker. Subject-Verb agreement and all that.

"I have honor; I have not but touched ekko ever in mine* own lifetime." would be more correct even if you're trying to mimic older Anglo-Saxon grammatical rules for sake of consistency with HeadHonchkrow.

*'mine' and 'thine' were used to prevent a vowel ending from leading into the second word that is led by a vowel sound because it sounded better, probably due to French influence on the English language, but I'm only guessing on that part.

For future reference: thou, thee, thyself, thy, and thine are always second-person pronouns.
